result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon Armando Raybon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Trevon Armando Raybon.  Attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. State may possibly be filing new charges against the Defendant and requests this matter be set for plea hearing or jury trial.  Court sets the deadline of 1/30/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms.  Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 10:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Trevon Armando Raybon.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken for Patricia Daugherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion held regarding possible new charge being filed.  State places current offer on the record.  Court sets this matter for adjourned Scheduling Conference.  Attorney Daugherty is ordered to appear for the next hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac appeared by video for Trevon Armando Raybon.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests adjourned Scheduling conference. Case adjourned to Br 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for Attorney Tricia Daughtery for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Case in court for Arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled "no plea".  The court enters plea of not guilty.

Parties are awaiting receipt of medical records.  State requests additional time to further investigate any additional charges.  Court sets this matter for Scheduling conference.
Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court by video with Attorney Peter J. Kovac who appears in person.  Stephanie Krueger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defense requests an arraignment date. 
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Arraignment scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-26-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Trevon Armando Raybon in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trevon Armando Raybon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense request to be heard on bail at the preliminary hearing.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
